summary: This document is an email chain from March 16, 2020, discussing a FOX Business inquiry about U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman's public comments on the Epstein investigation and Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation. The emails show internal deliberation about how to respond to the reporter, with Berman suggesting an off-the-record justification for his public statements.

events.title: Berman's public comments on Prince Andrew
events.description: Geoffrey Berman made public comments, reportedly twice, about Prince Andrew's unwillingness to cooperate with the Epstein investigation, which is noted as unusual per DOJ guidelines.

keyFacts: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman had spoken publicly about the Epstein investigation and Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation on at least two occasions, which was viewed as unusual by former federal prosecutors.

Prince Andrew had issued a press release offering to cooperate, which Berman's office believed created a 'public misperception' and a 'misperception on behalf of Epstein's victims' that he was actually cooperating.
Berman suggested an off-the-record justification for his public comments, citing a 'unique situation' and an 'important law enforcement interest to set the record straight.'
The internal email chain shows deliberation about whether responding to the media inquiry would violate any DOJ policies.
